alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Northern Hudspeth Highlands, Hueco Mountains; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 9:18PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central El Paso County through 915 PM MDT... At 815 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a group of strong thunderstorms over northern Mexico just southwest of El Paso County. These storms were moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35At 815 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a group of strong thunderstorms over northern Mexico just southwest of El Paso County. These storms were moving northeast at 15 mph. mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... East El Paso, Central El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Clint, Horizon City, San Elizario, Socorro, Sparks, Homestead Meadows, Butterfield, Agua Dulce, Dairyland, Lake Way Estates, Montana Vista and Colonia del Paso. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas near mile marker 19, and between mile markers 23 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
